intro: Hebe imbricata, commonly known as the silver hebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and clusters of blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Hebe imbricata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its compact growth habit and long blooming period. It is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
